body: Tip: For functions that take many arguments, and especially for values that don't mean anything when read, like `nullptr`, it's good practice to use what we call "LLVM-style comments" by writing `/*name_of_argument=*/value` so that the reader has a better idea of what is going on without having to consult the function declaration
body_html: Tip: For functions that take many arguments, and especially for values that don't mean anything when read, like nullptr, it's good practice to use what we call "LLVM-style comments" by writing /*name_of_argument=*/value so that the reader has a better idea of what is going on without having to consult the function declaration
body_text: Tip: For functions that take many arguments, and especially for values that don't mean anything when read, like nullptr, it's good practice to use what we call "LLVM-style comments" by writing /*name_of_argument=*/value so that the reader has a better idea of what is going on without having to consult the function declaration
